clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Risk Reduction Among African American Parishioners
clinical_study.official_title: Multilevel, Multidisciplinary, Faith-Based Participatory Interventions to Reduce COVID-19 Related-Risks Among Underserved African Americans

lead_sponsor.agency: Charles Drew University of Medicine and Science

clinical_study.source: Charles Drew University of Medicine and Science

brief_summary.textblock: African American adults, specifically those managing chronic disease and social isolation, are one of the most vulnerable groups susceptible to COVID-19. This intervention involves a multi-disciplinary and culturally sensitive approach to address two major COVID-19 related challenges in this population. First, this program collaborates with predominantly African American churches to implement Federal and State guidelines aimed at preventing outbreaks of COVID-19 at faith-based gatherings. Second, this program trains church-based health advisors to help African American older parishioners manage their chronic health conditions and reduce psychological distress during the pandemic.

detailed_description.textblock: To jointly implement and evaluate a telehealth-based, multidisciplinary, culturally-sensitive intervention with 265 AA older parishioners: (i) To mitigate the negative impact of COVID-19 on the management of chronic health conditions, and (ii) to reduce healthcare avoidance behaviors and psychological distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Improvement of Health Conditions Using the Severity of Medical Chronic Conditions Surveys
primary_outcome.description: From pre-intervention to three-month post-intervention, a 30% change is anticipated for chronic physical and mental disease management among African American older adults

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Target Levels of Knowledge, Attitude, and Behaviors with NIH Toolbox Surveys
primary_outcome.description: From pre-intervention to three-month post-intervention, an 80% change is anticipated in knowledge, attitude, and behaviors of COVID-19 risk among African American older adults

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of COVID-19 testing using Participant COVID-19 Test History Survey
primary_outcome.description: From pre-intervention to three-month post-intervention, a 40% change is anticipated for COVID-19 testing among the population of African American Older adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of pneumococcal and influenza vaccinations using Participant Immunization History Survey
primary_outcome.description: From pre-intervention to three-month post-intervention, a 70% change is anticipated in uptake of pneumococcal and influenza vaccinations among the population of African American Older adults.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Risk Reduction of COVID-19 Among African American Parishioners
arm_group.description: This arm will implement "one group pretest-posttest" design to improve COVID associated health outcomes of AA older parishioners in collaboration with trained young church-based health educators.

intervention.intervention_name: Change in knowledge, motivation, skills, resources
intervention.description: Provide/enhance knowledge, modify attitudes, motivate and provide skills and resources to reduce COVID-19 related risk and challenges.
intervention.arm_group_label: Risk Reduction of COVID-19 Among African American Parishioners

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- African American older adults aged 65 years
- Have at least one risk factor for COVID-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Resident of care facility
- Cognitive deficit (identified by short version of mini-mental instrument)
- Does not self-identify as African American and/or Black
- Under the age of 65
- Unable to speak and/or read English
